data.name: 1.2.1 Identification of Information Assets
data.description: Standards for classifying your organization’s information assets should be defined based on the nature of its activities. All information assets within the information security management system should be identified and classified. Then their importance is measured, and the list of the assets should be kept up to date.

tests.title: Unused EBS Volumes
tests.description: Ensures EBS volumes are in use and attached to EC2 instances
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should be deleted if the parent instance has been deleted to prevent accidental exposure of data.
tests.recommended_action: Delete the unassociated EBS volume.

tests.title: Aqua Container Inventory
tests.description: Performs an inventory analysis of container clusters, registries, and repositories.
tests.more_info: This is an informational plugin that collects data about the container-based services running in the connected account.
tests.recommended_action: No action is required. This is an informational plugin only.

data.name: 2.1.3 Management of Information Assets
data.description: Handling procedures and protective measures should be adopted based on the use and significance of your information assets. Accountability for each of the assets should be clearly defined and managed.

tests.title: Unused EBS Volumes
tests.description: Ensures EBS volumes are in use and attached to EC2 instances
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should be deleted if the parent instance has been deleted to prevent accidental exposure of data.
tests.recommended_action: Delete the unassociated EBS volume.

data.name: 2.3.3 Managing Implementation of Outsider Security
data.description: Implementation by outsiders of protective measures should be reviewed by means of an inspection, audit or otherwise, in accordance with the information security and privacy requirements set out in applicable agreements, arrangements or internal policies.

tests.title: CloudTrail Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail is enabled for all regions within an account
tests.more_info: CloudTrail should be enabled for all regions in order to detect suspicious activity in regions that are not typically used.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail for all regions and ensure that at least one region monitors global service events

results.message: CloudTrail is not configured to monitor global services

tests.title: CloudTrail To CloudWatch
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logs are being properly delivered to CloudWatch
tests.more_info: Sending CloudTrail logs to CloudWatch enables easy integration with AWS CloudWatch alerts, as well as an additional backup log storage location.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail CloudWatch integration for all regions

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Access Logging
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has access logging enabled to detect tampering of log files
tests.more_info: CloudTrail buckets should utilize access logging for an additional layer of auditing. If the log files are deleted or modified in any way, the additional access logs can help determine who made the changes.
tests.recommended_action: Enable access logging on the CloudTrail bucket from the S3 console

tests.title: CloudTrail Data Events
tests.description: Ensure Data events are included into Amazon CloudTrail trails configuration.
tests.more_info: AWS CloudTrail trails should be configured to enable Data Events in order to log S3 object-level API operations.
tests.recommended_action: Update CloudTrail to enable data events.

tests.title: CloudTrail Notifications Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon CloudTrail trails are using active Simple Notification Service (SNS) topics to deliver notifications.
tests.more_info: CloudTrail trails should reference active SNS topics to notify for log files delivery to S3 buckets. Otherwise, you will lose the ability to take immediate actions based on log information.
tests.recommended_action: Make sure that CloudTrail trails are using active SNS topics and that SNS topics have not been deleted after trail creation.

data.name: 2.5.1 Management of User Accounts
data.description: Procedures for registering and deregistering users and granting, modifying and nullifying access rights should be adopted and fully implemented to control unauthorized access to your information systems, personal data and other critical information and minimize access rights granted for business purposes. At the time of user registration and granting of rights, ensure that users fully understand that it is their responsibility to comply with security obligations.

tests.title: Root MFA Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for the root account
tests.more_info: The root account should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication.
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the root account and then use an IAM user for managing services

results.message: An MFA device was not found for the root account

tests.title: Root Access Keys
tests.description: Ensures the root account is not using access keys
tests.more_info: The root account should avoid using access keys. Since the root account has full permissions across the entire account, creating access keys for it only increases the chance that they are compromised. Instead, create IAM users with predefined roles.
tests.recommended_action: Remove access keys for the root account and setup IAM users with limited permissions instead

results.message: Access keys were not found for the root account

tests.title: Users MFA Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for all users within the account
tests.more_info: User accounts should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the user account

tests.title: Access Keys Rotated
tests.description: Ensures access keys are not older than 180 days in order to reduce accidental exposures
tests.more_info: Access keys should be rotated frequently to avoid having them accidentally exposed.
tests.recommended_action: To rotate an access key, first create a new key, replace the key and secret throughout your app or scripts, then set the previous key to disabled. Once you ensure that no services are broken, then fully delete the old key.

tests.title: Root Account In Use
tests.description: Ensures the root account is not being actively used
tests.more_info: The root account should not be used for day-to-day account management. IAM users, roles, and groups should be used instead.
tests.recommended_action: Create IAM users with appropriate group-level permissions for account access. Create an MFA token for the root account, and store its password and token generation QR codes in a secure place.

results.message: Root account was last used 0 days ago

tests.title: No User IAM Policies
tests.description: Ensures IAM policies are not connected directly to IAM users
tests.more_info: To reduce management complexity, IAM permissions should only be assigned to roles and groups. Users can then be added to those groups. Policies should not be applied directly to a user.
tests.recommended_action: Create groups with the required policies, move the IAM users to the applicable groups, and then remove the inline and directly attached policies from the IAM user.

tests.title: IAM User Admins
tests.description: Ensures the number of IAM admins in the account are minimized
tests.more_info: While at least two IAM admin users should be configured, the total number of admins should be kept to a minimum.
tests.recommended_action: Keep two users with admin permissions but ensure other IAM users have more limited permissions.

tests.title: IAM Role Policies
tests.description: Ensures IAM role policies are properly scoped with specific permissions
tests.more_info: Policies attached to IAM roles should be scoped to least-privileged access and avoid the use of wildcards.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all IAM roles are scoped to specific services and API calls.

results.message: Role does not have overly-permissive policy
Role does not have overly-permissive policy
Role does not have overly-permissive policy
Role does not have overly-permissive policy

tests.title: Root Hardware MFA
tests.description: Ensures the root account is using a hardware MFA device
tests.more_info: The root account should use a hardware MFA device for added security, rather than a virtual device which could be more easily compromised.
tests.recommended_action: Enable a hardware MFA device for the root account and disable any virtual devices

tests.title: Root Account Active Signing Certificates
tests.description: Ensures the root user is not using x509 signing certificates
tests.more_info: AWS supports using x509 signing certificates for API access, but these should not be attached to the root user, which has full access to the account.
tests.recommended_action: Delete the x509 certificates associated with the root account.

results.message: The root user does not use x509 signing certificates.

tests.title: Group Inline Policies
tests.description: Ensures that groups do not have any inline policies
tests.more_info: Managed Policies are recommended over inline policies.
tests.recommended_action: Remove inline policies attached to groups

tests.title: EKS Secrets Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures EKS clusters are configured to enable envelope encryption of Kubernetes secrets using KMS.
tests.more_info: Amazon EKS clusters should be configured to enable envelope encryption for Kubernetes secrets to adhere to security best practice for applications that store sensitive data.
tests.recommended_action: Modify EKS clusters to enable envelope encryption for Kubernetes secrets

tests.title: Secrets Manager Secret Rotation Enabled
tests.description: Ensures AWS Secrets Manager is configured to automatically rotate the secret for a secured service or database.
tests.more_info: Secrets Manager rotation makes access to your databases and third-party services secure by automatically rotating secrets used to access these resources.
tests.recommended_action: Enable secret rotation for your secrets

tests.title: Secrets Manager Encrypted Secrets
tests.description: Ensures Secrets Manager Secrets are encrypted
tests.more_info: Secrets Manager Secrets should be encrypted. This allows their values to be used by approved systems, while restricting access to other users of the account.
tests.recommended_action: Encrypt Secrets Manager Secrets

tests.title: IAM Policies Present
tests.description: Ensure that required policies are present in all IAM roles.
tests.more_info: Validate the presence of required policies in IAM roles in order to follow your organizations's security and compliance requirements.
tests.recommended_action: Modify IAM roles to attach required policies

tests.title: KMS Grant Least Privilege
tests.description: Ensure that AWS KMS key grants use the principle of least privileged access.
tests.more_info: AWS KMS key grants should be created with minimum set of permissions required by grantee principal to adhere to AWS security best practices.
tests.recommended_action: Create KMS grants with minimum permission required

tests.title: EMR Cluster In VPC
tests.description: Ensure that your Amazon Elastic MapReduce (EMR) clusters are provisioned using the AWS VPC platform instead of EC2-Classic platform.
tests.more_info: AWS EMR clusters using VPC platform instead of EC2-Classic can bring multiple advantages such as better networking infrastructure, much more flexible control over access security .
tests.recommended_action: EMR clusters Available in VPC

tests.title: Secrets Manager In Use
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Secrets Manager service is being used in your account to manage all the credentials.
tests.more_info: Amazon Secrets Manager helps you protect sensitive information needed to access your cloud applications, services and resources. Users and apps can use secrets manager to get the secrets stored with a call to Secrets Manager API, enhancing access security.
tests.recommended_action: Use Secrets Manager service to store sensitive information in your AWS account.

tests.title: CloudFormation Admin Priviliges
tests.description: Ensures no AWS CloudFormation stacks available in your AWS account has admin privileges.
tests.more_info: A service role is an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows AWS CloudFormation to make calls to resources in a stack on your behalf. You can specify an IAM role that allows AWS CloudFormation to create, update, or delete your stack resources
tests.recommended_action: Modify IAM role attached with AWS CloudFormation stack to provide the minimal amount of access required to perform its tasks

results.message: CloudFormation stack does not have a role attached

data.name: 2.5.3 User authentication
data.description: Access by users to your information systems, personal data and other critical information should go through secure process of authentication and, if needed, more robust authentication mechanism. Methods to control unauthorized access should be deployed and fully implemented, including limitations on the number of login attempts and alerts to be triggered in the event of any illegal login attempt.

data.name: 2.5.4 Password Management
data.description: Procedures should be adopted and fully implemented to manage passwords used by data subjects (users), including those accessing your information system, customers and members, in consideration of legal requirements and other sources of external threats.

tests.title: Minimum Password Length
tests.description: Ensures password policy requires a password of at least a minimum number of characters
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Increase the minimum length requirement for the password policy
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for minimum password length will be set to the value set by the user. Otherwise, it will default to 14.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Password Requires Symbols
tests.description: Ensures password policy requires the use of symbols
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Update the password policy to require the use of symbols
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password requires symbols will be set to true.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Maximum Password Age
tests.description: Ensures password policy requires passwords to be reset every 180 days
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Descrease the maximum allowed age of passwords for the password policy
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for maximum password age will be set to the value set by the user. Otherwise, it will default to 179.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Password Reuse Prevention
tests.description: Ensures password policy prevents previous password reuse
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Increase the minimum previous passwords that can be reused to 24.
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password reuse prevention will be set to the value set by the user. Otherwise, it will default to 24.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Enable password expiration for the account
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password expiration will be set to true.

tests.recommended_action: Update the password policy to require the use of lowercase letters
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password requires lowercase will be set to true.

tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password requires uppercase will be set to true.

tests.title: Users Password Last Used
tests.description: Detects users with password logins that have not been used for a period of time and that should be decommissioned
tests.more_info: Having numerous, unused user accounts extends the attack surface. If users do not log into their accounts for more than the defined period of time, the account should be deleted.
tests.recommended_action: Delete old user accounts that allow password-based logins and have not been used recently.

tests.title: Users Password And Keys
tests.description: Detects whether users with a console password are also using access keys
tests.more_info: Access keys should only be assigned to machine users and should not be used for accounts that have console password access.
tests.recommended_action: Remove access keys from all users with console access.

data.name: 2.5.5 Control of Special Accounts and Permissions
data.description: Accounts and permissions granted for the control of special purposes including management of your information systems, personal data and critical information should be kept to a minimal level. All of them should also be identified and properly controlled.

tests.title: Root MFA Enabled

tests.more_info: The root account should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication.
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the root account and then use an IAM user for managing services

tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the user account

tests.title: Root Hardware MFA
tests.description: Ensures the root account is using a hardware MFA device
tests.more_info: The root account should use a hardware MFA device for added security, rather than a virtual device which could be more easily compromised.
tests.recommended_action: Enable a hardware MFA device for the root account and disable any virtual devices

tests.title: App-Tier EC2 Instance IAM Role
tests.description: Ensure IAM roles attached with App-Tier EC2 instances have IAM policies attached.
tests.more_info: EC2 instances should have IAM roles configured with necessary permission to access other AWS services
tests.recommended_action: Modify EC2 instances to attach IAM roles with required IAM policies

tests.title: Web-Tier EC2 Instance IAM Role
tests.description: Ensure IAM roles attached with Web-Tier EC2 instances have IAM policies attached.
tests.more_info: EC2 instances should have IAM roles configured with necessary permission to access other AWS services
tests.recommended_action: Modify EC2 instances to attach IAM roles with required IAM policies

data.name: 2.6 Access control
data.description: To control unauthorized access to your network, management procedures for, among other things, IP management and terminal authentication should be adopted and implemented. Network separation and access control should be applied based on the purpose and significance of business (i.e. DMZ, server farm, DB zone, development zone).

tests.title: Open SSH
tests.description: Determine if TCP port 22 for SSH is open to the public
tests.more_info: While some ports such as HTTP and HTTPS are required to be open to the public to function properly, more sensitive services such as SSH should be restricted to known IP addresses.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP port 22 to known IP addresses
tests.remediation_description: The impacted security group rule will be deleted if no input is provided. Otherwise, any input will replace the open CIDR rule.

tests.title: S3 Bucket All Users ACL
tests.description: Ensures S3 buckets do not allow global write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: S3 buckets can be configured to allow anyone, regardless of whether they are an AWS user or not, to write objects to a bucket or delete objects. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global all users policies on all S3 buckets and ensure both the bucket ACL is configured with least privileges.
tests.remediation_description: Bucket ACL will be modified to be private to bucket owner.

tests.title: Notebook Direct Internet Access
tests.description: Ensure Notebook Instance is not publicly available.
tests.more_info: SageMaker notebooks should not be exposed to the Internet. Public availability can be configured via the DirectInternetAccess attribute.
tests.recommended_action: Disable DirectInternetAccess for each SageMaker notebook.

tests.title: Lambda Public Access
tests.description: Ensures Lambda functions are not accessible globally
tests.more_info: The Lambda function execution policy should not allow public invocation of the function.
tests.recommended_action: Update the Lambda policy to prevent access from the public.

tests.title: EKS Private Endpoint
tests.description: Ensures the private endpoint setting is enabled for EKS clusters
tests.more_info: EKS private endpoints can be used to route all traffic between the Kubernetes worker and control plane nodes over a private VPC endpoint rather than across the public internet.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the private endpoint setting for all EKS clusters.

tests.title: CloudFront WAF Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions have WAF enabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling WAF allows control over requests to the Cloudfront Distribution, allowing or denying traffic based off rules in the Web ACL
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the WAF service. 2. Enter Web ACLs and filter by global. 3. If no Web ACL is found, Create a new global Web ACL and in Resource type to associate with web ACL, select the Cloudfront Distribution.

tests.title: ELB WAF Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that all Application Load Balancers have WAF enabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling WAF allows control over requests to the load balancer, allowing or denying traffic based off rules in the Web ACL
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the WAF service. 2. Enter Web ACLs and filter by the region the Application Load Balancer is in. 3. If no Web ACL is found, Create a new Web ACL in the region the ALB resides and in Resource type to associate with web ACL, select the Load Balancer.

tests.title: Root Hardware MFA
tests.description: Ensures the root account is using a hardware MFA device
tests.more_info: The root account should use a hardware MFA device for added security, rather than a virtual device which could be more easily compromised.
tests.recommended_action: Enable a hardware MFA device for the root account and disable any virtual devices

tests.title: ElasticSearch Public Service Domain
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domains are created with private VPC endpoint options
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains can either be created with a public endpoint or with a VPC configuration that enables internal VPC communication. Domains should be created without a public endpoint to prevent potential public access to the domain.
tests.recommended_action: Configure the ElasticSearch domain to use a VPC endpoint for secure VPC communication.

tests.title: Default VPC Exists
tests.description: Determines whether the default VPC exists.
tests.more_info: The default VPC should not be used in order to avoid launching multiple services in the same network which may not require connectivity. Each application, or network tier, should use its own VPC.
tests.recommended_action: Move resources from the default VPC to a new VPC created for that application or resource group.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Public Access Block
tests.description: Ensures S3 public access block is enabled on all buckets or for AWS account
tests.more_info: Blocking S3 public access at the account level or bucket-level ensures objects are not accidentally exposed.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the S3 public access block on all S3 buckets or for AWS account.

tests.title: ELBv2 WAF Enabled

data.name: 2.6.6 Control of Remote Access
data.description: Managing your information systems and processing personal data outside protected areas should be prohibited. If remote access is inevitable due to working at home, response to failures, remote collaboration or otherwise, protective measures should be adopted and implemented, including approval by the person in charge, user-specific terminals, defining of scope of access and term, extra powerful authentication, sectional encryption and security measures for the access terminal (i.e. antivirus, patch).

data.name: 2.6.7 Control of Internet Access
data.description: To prevent information leakage through the Internet, infection with malicious code, intrusion into your internal network or other similar incidents, an Internet access control policy should be adopted specifying, among other things, that the Internet or other similar services (i.e. P2P, web hard, messenger) should not be accessed from your critical information systems, terminals where important business is conducted or personal data are processed, or other comparable devices.

tests.title: Redshift Cluster CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Redshift clusters are encrypted using KMS customer master keys (CMKs)
tests.more_info: KMS CMKs should be used to encrypt redshift clusters in order to have full control over data encryption and decryption.
tests.recommended_action: Update Redshift clusters encryption configuration to use KMS CMKs instead of AWS managed-keys.

tests.title: Redshift Parameter Group SSL Required
tests.description: Ensures AWS Redshift non-default parameter group associated with Redshift cluster require SSL connection.
tests.more_info: Redshift parameter group associated with Redshift cluster should be configured to require SSL to secure data in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Update Redshift parameter groups to have require-ssl parameter set to true.

tests.title: ELBv2 NLB Listener Security
tests.description: Ensures that AWS Network Load Balancers have secured listener configured.
tests.more_info: AWS Network Load Balancer should have TLS protocol listener configured to terminate TLS traffic.
tests.recommended_action: Attach TLS listener to AWS Network Load Balancer

tests.title: Redshift Cluster Audit Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensure audit logging is enabled for Redshift clusters for security and troubleshooting purposes.
tests.more_info: Redshift clusters should be configured to enable audit logging to log cluster usage information.
tests.recommended_action: Modify Redshift clusters to enable audit logging

tests.title: App-Tier ELB Security Policy
tests.description: Ensures that AWS App-Tier ELBs are using the latest predefined security policies.
tests.more_info: AWS App-Tier ELBs should use the latest predefined security policies to secure the connection between client and ELB.
tests.recommended_action: Update App-Tier ELB reference security policy to latest predefined security policy to secure the connection between client and ELB

tests.title: WorkSpaces Volume Encryption
tests.description: Ensures volume encryption on WorkSpaces for data protection.
tests.more_info: AWS WorkSpaces should have volume encryption enabled in order to protect data from unauthorized access.
tests.recommended_action: Modify WorkSpaces to enable volume encryption

tests.title: Image Recipe Storage Volumes Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure that Image Recipe storage ebs volumes are encrypted.
tests.more_info: EC2 Image Builder is a fully managed AWS service that makes it easier to automate the creation, management, and deployment of customized, secure, and up-to-date server images that are pre-installed and pre-configured with software and settings to meet specific IT standards.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that storage volumes for ebs are encrypted using AWS keys or customer managed keys in Image recipe

data.name: 2.7.2 Encryption key management
data.description: Procedures should be adopted to ensure secure creation, use, storage, distribution and destruction of encryption keys. A plan should be adopted for recovery if required.

tests.title: KMS Key Rotation
tests.description: Ensures KMS keys are set to rotate on a regular schedule
tests.more_info: All KMS keys should have key rotation enabled. AWS will handle the rotation of the encryption key itself, as well as storage of previous keys, so previous data does not need to be re-encrypted before the rotation occurs.
tests.recommended_action: Enable yearly rotation for the KMS key

data.name: 2.7.1 Application of Encryption Policy
data.description: To ensure protection of personal data and other critical information, a policy should be adopted concerning what should be encrypted, how strong passwords should be and how they should be used. Encryption should be applied when personal data or other critical information is stored, transmitted or delivered.

tests.title: API Gateway Client Certificate
tests.description: Ensures that Amazon API Gateway API stages use client certificates.
tests.more_info: API Gateway API stages should use client certificates to ensure API security authorization.
tests.recommended_action: Attach client certificate to API Gateway API stages

tests.title: ELB SSL Termination
tests.description: Ensure that Load Balancers has SSL certificate configured for SSL terminations.
tests.more_info: SSL termination or SSL offloading decrypts and verifies data on the load balancer instead of the application server which spares the server of having to organize incoming connections and prioritize on other tasks like loading web pages. This helps increase server speed.
tests.recommended_action: Attach SSL certificate with the listener to AWS Elastic Load Balancer

data.name: 2.9.1 Change control
data.description: Procedures should be adopted to keep track of all changes made to assets related to your information system. Prior to change, any impact it might have on the performance and security of the system should be analyzed.

tests.title: CloudTrail Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail is enabled for all regions within an account
tests.more_info: CloudTrail should be enabled for all regions in order to detect suspicious activity in regions that are not typically used.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail for all regions and ensure that at least one region monitors global service events

results.message: CloudTrail is not configured to monitor global services

tests.title: CloudTrail File Validation
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail file validation is enabled for all regions within an account
tests.more_info: CloudTrail file validation is essentially a hash of the file which can be used to ensure its integrity in the case of an account compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail file validation for all regions
tests.remediation_description: File validation will be enabled for the trail

data.name: 2.9.2 Management of Performance and Failures
data.description: To ensure the availability of your information systems, their performance and capacity requirements should be defined and monitored continuously, and procedures for detection, recording, analysis, recovery and reporting should be adopted and maintained for more effective response to failures.

tests.title: CloudWatch Monitoring Metrics
tests.description: Ensures metric filters are setup for CloudWatch logs to detect security risks from CloudTrail.
tests.more_info: Sending CloudTrail logs to CloudWatch is only useful if metrics are setup to detect risky activity from those logs. There are numerous metrics that should be used. For the exact filter patterns, please see this plugin on GitHub: https://github.com/cloudsploit/scans/blob/master/plugins/aws/cloudwatchlogs/monitoringMetrics.js
tests.recommended_action: Enable metric filters to detect malicious activity in CloudTrail logs sent to CloudWatch.

tests.title: Empty AutoScaling Group
tests.description: Ensures all autoscaling groups contain at least 1 instance.
tests.more_info: AutoScaling groups that are no longer in use should be deleted to prevent accidental use.
tests.recommended_action: Delete the unused AutoScaling group.

tests.title: AutoScaling ELB Same Availability Zone
tests.description: Ensures all autoscaling groups with attached ELBs are operating in the same availability zone.
tests.more_info: To work properly and prevent orphaned instances, ELBs must be created in the same availability zones as the backend instances in the autoscaling group.
tests.recommended_action: Update the ELB to use the same availability zones as the autoscaling group.

tests.title: Suspended AutoScaling Groups
tests.description: Ensures that there are no Amazon AutoScaling groups with suspended processes.
tests.more_info: AutoScaling groups should not have any suspended processes to avoid disrupting the AutoScaling workflow.
tests.recommended_action: Update the AutoScaling group to resume the suspended processes.

tests.title: VPC Flow Logs Metric Alarm
tests.description: Ensure that an AWS CloudWatch alarm exists and configured for metric filter attached with VPC flow logs CloudWatch group.
tests.more_info: A metric alarm watches a single CloudWatch metric or the result of a math expression based on CloudWatch metrics. The alarm performs one or more actions based on the value of the metric or expression relative to a threshold over a number of time periods. The action can be sending a notification to an Amazon SNS topic.
tests.recommended_action: Create a CloudWatch group, attached metric filter to log VPC flow logs changes and create an CloudWatch alarm for the metric filter.

data.name: 2.9.3 Management of Backup and Recovery
data.description: To maintain the availability of your information systems and ensure data integrity, procedures should be adopted, specifying what should be backed up, how and how often they should be backed up, where and how long they should be stored and that they should be dispersed. Ensure that recovery can take place in a timely manner in the event of an incident.

tests.title: RDS Automated Backups
tests.description: Ensures automated backups are enabled for RDS instances
tests.more_info: AWS provides a simple method of backing up RDS instances at a regular interval. This should be enabled to provide an option for restoring data in the event of a database compromise or hardware failure.
tests.recommended_action: Enable automated backups for the RDS instance

tests.title: RDS Multiple AZ
tests.description: Ensures that RDS instances are created to be cross-AZ for high availability.
tests.more_info: Creating RDS instances in a single AZ creates a single point of failure for all systems relying on that database. All RDS instances should be created in multiple AZs to ensure proper failover.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the RDS instance to enable scaling across multiple availability zones.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Versioning
tests.description: Ensures object versioning is enabled on S3 buckets
tests.more_info: Object versioning can help protect against the overwriting of                 objects or data loss in the event of a compromise.
tests.recommended_action: Enable object versioning for buckets with                         sensitive contents at a minimum and for all buckets                         ideally.
tests.remediation_description: The impacted bucket will be configured to be have Versioning enabled.

tests.title: DynamoDB Continuous Backups
tests.description: Ensures that Amazon DynamoDB tables have continuous backups enabled.
tests.more_info: DynamoDB tables should have Continuous Backups and Point-In-Time Recovery (PITR) features enabled to protect DynamoDB data against accidental data writes.
tests.recommended_action: Enable Continuous Backups and Point-In-Time Recovery (PITR) features.

tests.title: VPN Tunnel State
tests.description: Ensures that each AWS Virtual Private Network (VPN) connection has all tunnels up.
tests.more_info: AWS Virtual Private Network (VPN) should have tunnels up to ensure network traffic flow over Virtual Private Network.
tests.recommended_action: Establish a successful VPN connection using IKE or IPsec configuration

tests.title: ELB Cross-Zone Load Balancing
tests.description: Ensures that AWS ELBs have cross-zone load balancing enabled.
tests.more_info: AWS ELBs should have cross-zone load balancing enabled to distribute the traffic evenly across the registered instances in all enabled Availability Zones.
tests.recommended_action: Update AWS ELB to enable cross zone load balancing

tests.title: RDS Deletion Protection Enabled
tests.description: Ensures deletion protection is enabled for RDS database instances.
tests.more_info: Deletion protection prevents Amazon RDS instances from being deleted accidentally by any user.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the RDS instances to enable deletion protection.

tests.title: EBS Backup Enabled
tests.description: Checks whether EBS Backup is enabled
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should have backups in the form of snapshots.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that each EBS volumes contain at least .

tests.title: Backup In Use For RDS Snapshots
tests.description: Ensure that Amazon Backup is integrated with Amazon Relational Database Service in order to manage RDS database instance snapshots
tests.more_info: Amazon RDS creates and saves automated backups of your DB instance during the backup window of your DB instance. With Amazon Backup, you can centrally configure backup policies and rules, and monitor backup activity for AWS RDS database instances.
tests.recommended_action: Enable RDS database instance snapshots to improve the reliability of your backup strategy.

data.name: 2.9.4 Management of Log and Access Record
data.description: Ensure that record of access by users to your information systems including servers, applications, security systems and network systems, system logs and details of rights granted are fully maintained. Define how and how long they should be retained. Ensure that they are safely retained and maintained so that none of them is falsified, forged, stolen or lost.

tests.title: VPC Flow Logs Enabled
tests.description: Ensures VPC flow logs are enabled for traffic logging
tests.more_info: VPC flow logs record all traffic flowing in to and out of a VPC. These logs are critical for auditing and review after security incidents.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VPC flow logs for each VPC

tests.title: ELB Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures load balancers have request logging enabled.
tests.more_info: Logging requests to ELB endpoints is a helpful way of detecting and investigating potential attacks, malicious activity, or misuse of backend resources.Logs can be sent to S3 and processed for further analysis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable ELB request logging

tests.title: S3 Bucket Logging
tests.description: Ensures S3 bucket logging is enabled for S3 buckets
tests.more_info: S3 bucket logging helps maintain an audit trail of                 access that can be used in the event of a security                 incident.
tests.recommended_action: Enable bucket logging for each S3 bucket.

tests.title: CloudTrail Data Events
tests.description: Ensure Data events are included into Amazon CloudTrail trails configuration.
tests.more_info: AWS CloudTrail trails should be configured to enable Data Events in order to log S3 object-level API operations.
tests.recommended_action: Update CloudTrail to enable data events.

tests.title: CloudWatch Log Retention Period
tests.description: Ensures that the CloudWatch Log retention period is set above a specified length of time.
tests.more_info: Retention settings can be used to specify how long log events are kept in CloudWatch Logs. Expired log events get deleted automatically.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure CloudWatch logs are retained for at least 90 days.

tests.more_info: API Gateway API stages should have Amazon CloudWatch Logs enabled to help debug issues related to request execution or client access to your API.

tests.title: AWS WAFV2 In Use
tests.description: Ensure that AWS Web Application Firewall V2 (WAFV2) is in use to achieve availability and security for AWS-powered web applications.
tests.more_info: Using WAF for your web application running in AWS environment can help you against common web-based attacks, SQL injection attacks, DDOS attacks and more.
tests.recommended_action: Create one or more WAF ACLs with proper actions and rules

data.name: 2.10.3 Public server security
data.description: Your servers accessible from external network should be isolated from your internal network. More robust protective measures should be taken, consisting of procedures for identification of vulnerability, access control, authentication and collection, storage and publication of information.

tests.title: GuardDuty is Enabled
tests.description: Ensures GuardDuty is enabled
tests.more_info: GuardDuty provides threat intelligence by analyzing several AWS data sources for security risks and should be enabled in all accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Enable GuardDuty for all AWS accounts.

tests.title: Unused EBS Volumes
tests.description: Ensures EBS volumes are in use and attached to EC2 instances
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should be deleted if the parent instance has been deleted to prevent accidental exposure of data.
tests.recommended_action: Delete the unassociated EBS volume.

tests.title: Aqua Container Inventory
tests.description: Performs an inventory analysis of container clusters, registries, and repositories.
tests.more_info: This is an informational plugin that collects data about the container-based services running in the connected account.
tests.recommended_action: No action is required. This is an informational plugin only.

data.name: 2.10.5 Security for Transmission of Information
data.description: A policy for secure transmission should be adopted prior to transmission of personal data or other critical information to another department. The departments involved should agree on accountability, standards for transmission technology and technical protective measures to ensure the security of critical information.

tests.title: Insecure Ciphers
tests.description: Detect use of insecure ciphers on ELBs
tests.more_info: Various security vulnerabilities have rendered several ciphers insecure. Only the recommended ciphers should be used.
tests.recommended_action: Update your ELBs to use the recommended cipher suites

tests.title: ELB HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ELBs are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, ELBs can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections  will be blocked. This should only be done if the  client application is configured to query HTTPS  directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Remove non-HTTPS listeners from load balancer.
tests.remediation_description: All HTTP Listeners will be deleted

tests.title: Notebook Data Encrypted
tests.description: Ensure Notebook data is encrypted
tests.more_info: An optional encryption key can be supplied during Notebook Instance creation.
tests.recommended_action: An existing KMS key should be supplied during Notebook Instance creation.

tests.title: ELBv2 HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ELBs are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, ELBs can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections  will be blocked. This should only be done if the  client application is configured to query HTTPS  directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Remove non-HTTPS listeners from load balancer.
tests.remediation_description: All HTTP Listeners will be deleted

tests.title: Redshift Parameter Group SSL Required
tests.description: Ensures AWS Redshift non-default parameter group associated with Redshift cluster require SSL connection.
tests.more_info: Redshift parameter group associated with Redshift cluster should be configured to require SSL to secure data in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Update Redshift parameter groups to have require-ssl parameter set to true.

tests.title: ELBv2 NLB Listener Security
tests.description: Ensures that AWS Network Load Balancers have secured listener configured.
tests.more_info: AWS Network Load Balancer should have TLS protocol listener configured to terminate TLS traffic.
tests.recommended_action: Attach TLS listener to AWS Network Load Balancer

tests.title: App-Tier ELB Security Policy
tests.description: Ensures that AWS App-Tier ELBs are using the latest predefined security policies.
tests.more_info: AWS App-Tier ELBs should use the latest predefined security policies to secure the connection between client and ELB.
tests.recommended_action: Update App-Tier ELB reference security policy to latest predefined security policy to secure the connection between client and ELB

data.name: 2.10.8 Patch Management
data.description: Ensure that latest patches are applied all the time to prevent any compromise due to vulnerabilities in your software, operating system, security system or otherwise. If application of latest patches is not an option, alternative means should be provided based on review of consequences on the services.

tests.title: Unused EBS Volumes
tests.description: Ensures EBS volumes are in use and attached to EC2 instances
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should be deleted if the parent instance has been deleted to prevent accidental exposure of data.
tests.recommended_action: Delete the unassociated EBS volume.

data.name: 2.11.2 Identification of Vulnerabilities and Actions
data.description: To determine if the information system is exposed to any vulnerability, a vulnerability audit should be conducted on a regular basis. Any vulnerability identified should be promptly addressed. Any new security vulnerability should be identified all the time, and its impact on the information systems should be measured for proper actions.

tests.title: GuardDuty is Enabled
tests.description: Ensures GuardDuty is enabled
tests.more_info: GuardDuty provides threat intelligence by analyzing several AWS data sources for security risks and should be enabled in all accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Enable GuardDuty for all AWS accounts.
